info.title: GitHub File Proxy + Promote Patch Tool
info.description: Fetch GitHub repo files and generate patch metadata for AI-native delivery.

post.summary: Fetch file from GitHub repo (optionally by branch or ref)

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Single GitHub File
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to fetch a single file from a GitHub repo. Specify the repo name and file path.

ref.description: Optional Git ref (branch, tag, or commit SHA)

post.summary: Fetch multiple GitHub files via body input

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Multiple GitHub Files
x-gpt-action.instructions: Provide a list of file paths to fetch from the GitHub repo.

patch.summary: Update metadata fields for a task

x-gpt-action.name: Update Task Metadata
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to update specific metadata fields for a task.

x-gpt-action.name: List All Tasks
x-gpt-action.instructions: Fetch all tasks from the task.yaml file in the GitHub repo.

post.summary: Activate one or more tasks by updating their status to planned

x-gpt-action.name: Activate Tasks
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to activate tasks by updating their status to 'planned'.

post.summary: Clone an existing task and generate a new task ID and metadata

x-gpt-action.name: Clone Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to clone an existing task and generate a new task ID.

200.description: Task cloned and new task ID generated

get.summary: Return full metadata for a task

x-gpt-action.name: Get Task Details
x-gpt-action.instructions: Call this to get the full metadata for a specific task.

post.summary: Create a new task from a structured template

x-gpt-action.name: Create New Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to create a new task using a template defined in /framework/task_templates/<phase>/<task>.

task_key.description: Task folder name inside the phase template

task_id.description: Unique identifier for the new task

assigned_pod.description: Which Pod owns this task (e.g., DevPod)

prompt_variables.description: Optional variable values to inject into the prompt

post.summary: Index files into memory.yaml and auto-generate metadata

x-gpt-action.name: Index Memory Files
x-gpt-action.instructions: Call this to scan base_paths for new files and add them to memory.yaml with GPT-generated descriptions and tags.

base_paths.description: Optional list of base folders to scan for files

post.summary: Detect missing files in memory.yaml compared to GitHub repo

x-gpt-action.name: Diff Memory Files
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to find files that are in memory.yaml but not in the GitHub repo.

post.summary: Add files to memory.yaml with auto-generated metadata

x-gpt-action.name: Add Files to Memory
x-gpt-action.instructions: Provide a list of file paths. The system will auto-generate descriptions, tags, and pod owner using GPT.

post.summary: Validate that files exist in memory.yaml and GitHub

x-gpt-action.name: Validate Memory Files
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to check if files exist in memory.yaml and GitHub.

post.summary: Search memory.yaml for keyword matches in path, description, or tags

x-gpt-action.name: Search Memory by Keyword
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to find relevant memory files based on a keyword or phrase.

keyword.description: Keyword to search within memory entry path, tags, and description

get.description: Returns a grouped list of actions with names, paths, descriptions, and methods.

x-gpt-action.name: List Available Actions
x-gpt-action.instructions: Retrieve a list of actions grouped by functionality, including paths, descriptions, and supported methods.

200.description: List of available actions grouped by category

post.summary: Fetch the current project delivery and reasoning metrics summary

x-gpt-action.name: Get Delivery Metrics Summary
x-gpt-action.instructions: Retrieve a summary of delivery and reasoning metrics. Includes completion %, cycle time, and AI thinking insights.

example.reasoning_summary: Summary of the project’s AI thinking patterns and insights.

post.summary: Export raw reasoning_trace.yaml logs across tasks

x-gpt-action.name: Export Reasoning Logs
x-gpt-action.instructions: Export full reasoning_trace logs for all completed tasks in the project.

post.summary: Initialize a new project in the given repo

x-gpt-action.name: Initialize Project
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to set up a new project in the specified GitHub repository.

post.summary: Start a task and mark it in progress

x-gpt-action.name: Start Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to mark a task as in progress and update its status.

post.summary: Append a message to a task's chain_of_thought.yaml file

x-gpt-action.name: Append to Chain of Thought
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to append a message to a task's chain_of_thought.yaml file.

post.summary: Update project CHANGELOG with a new task entry

x-gpt-action.name: Update Changelog
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to add a new entry to the project's CHANGELOG file.

post.summary: Mark task complete and log outputs, trace, and handoff

x-gpt-action.name: Complete Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to mark a task as complete and log outputs, trace, and handoff.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

task_id.description: The ID of the task being completed

outputs.description: List of output files created by the task

reasoning_trace.description: Structured reasoning trace from the GPT pod for this task

handoff_note.description: Optional handoff note to the next pod or teammate

handoff_to_same_pod.description: Set to true to trigger a scale handoff to a new GPT of the same pod type

token_count.description: Approximate token usage so far, used to inform scale-out decisions

thoughts.thought: Used prior implementation spec to generate updated plan.
Added validation step to reduce future QA workload.

reasoning_trace.summary: Clear reasoning with useful reuse and small innovation.
alternatives: Could have used fixed schedule instead of retriggering after updates

handoff_note.next_prompt: Start with test plan for module A
handoff_note.notes: Some edge cases still need coverage.
handoff_note.ways_of_working: Follow async feedback loop via chain_of_thought.

post.summary: Retrieve the next available task(s) for a Pod

x-gpt-action.name: Get Next Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Find the next task(s) available for a specific pod_owner. Call /tasks/start to begin working.

200.description: List of ready tasks for this Pod

post.summary: Reopen a completed task and mark as in progress

x-gpt-action.name: Reopen Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to reopen a task that was previously marked as complete.

post.summary: Append a handoff note to a task

x-gpt-action.name: Append Handoff Note
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to append a handoff note to a task's metadata.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

from_pod.description: The name of the pod from which the task is being handed off (eg DevPod, QAPod, ResearchPod, DeliveryPod)

to_pod.description: The name of the pod to which the task is being handed off (eg DevPod, QAPod, ResearchPod, DeliveryPod)

token_count.description: The number of tokens used so far in the chat session

next_prompt.description: The next prompt for the task

reference_files.description: A list of reference files related to the task

ways_of_working.description: Description of the ways of working between gpt and user for the task

example.next_prompt: Please test component A and validate edge case B
example.notes: Watch out for flakiness in test X

post.summary: Retrieve latest handoff note from upstream task

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Handoff Note
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to retrieve the latest handoff note from an upstream task.

post.summary: Auto-generate a handoff note for a completed task

x-gpt-action.name: Auto-Generate Handoff Note
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to auto-generate a handoff note for a completed task.

post.summary: Commit and log a single output file for a task

x-gpt-action.name: Commit and Log Output File
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to commit and log a single output file for a task.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

task_id.description: The ID of the task being committed

file_path.description: The path to the file being committed

content.description: The content of the file being committed

message.description: The commit message for the file

committed_by.description: The name of the person or gpt pod committing the file

post.summary: Validate and optionally backfill changelog entries for completed tasks

x-gpt-action.name: Validate Changelog Entries
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to validate and optionally backfill changelog entries for completed tasks.

post.summary: Rollback specific files to previous commit

x-gpt-action.name: Rollback Commit
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to revert files to a previous commit version. Use with caution. Log a reason for rollback.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

commit_sha.description:
The SHA of the commit to rollback from.

How to find it:
- Use `git log` locally, or
- Visit the GitHub repo ➜ Commits tab ➜ Copy the commit hash
- Or call the `/git/list_commits` tool (if available)

paths.description: Optional list of file paths to revert. If omitted, all files from the commit will be reverted.

reason.description: Why the rollback is being performed (e.g., accidental overwrite, failed auto-index, etc.)

post.summary: Return the onboarding guide from GitHub

x-gpt-action.name: Get Onboarding Guide
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to retrieve onboarding instructions. Set `simple=true` for a non-technical guide.

simple.description: Set to true to retrieve a non-technical guide

post.summary: Link two tasks together via handoff

x-gpt-action.name: Auto-Handoff Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Link two tasks for seamless pod handoff and set the next one as ready.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

task_id.description: The ID of the task being handed off

next_task_id.description: The ID of the next task to be linked

handoff_mode.description: Mode of handoff: sync, async, or auto. Default is async.

post.summary: Create a new scaled-out task instance and optionally log a handoff note

x-gpt-action.name: Scale Out Task
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to clone a task into a new one when the current pod reaches token/context limits. Optionally provide a handoff note to carry over.

repo_name.description: The GitHub repo name where the task lives

task_id.description: The original task to scale out

reason.description: Why the scale-out is occurring (e.g., context/token overflow)

handoff_note.description: Optional structured handoff note to attach to the previous task

example.reason: Reached token limit while processing test cases.

handoff_note.ways_of_working: Start with what's left in reasoning trace

200.description: Returns new task ID and continuation context
